siteMetadata.title: A gentle introduction to the scientific Python ecosystem

frontmatter.title: Module 1: Introduction to Python
frontmatter.description: In this module, you will learn how to write basic Python code. Make sure that you go through the material provided by Project Pythia before attempting the exercises. Note that the first time you build the Binder, this may take some time. Also do not navigate away from the code block (e.g., by opening another exercise) as this will stop the execution.

frontmatter.title: Module 2: Introduction to Jupyter
frontmatter.description: This module will teach you how to use Jupyter Notebook/JupyterLab. We will be making use of these technologies for the reminder of the hackathon. There are no LinkedEarth specific exercises related to this module.

frontmatter.title: Module 3: Introduction to NumPy
frontmatter.description: This module will teach you about NumPy. NumPy arrays are the most basic data structure for Pyleoclim, underlying all the other packages. Virtually all operations made on the data involve NumPy arrays, so it is important to understand a bit about how they work.

frontmatter.title: Module 4: Introduction to Pandas
frontmatter.description: This model will teach you how to user Pandas. Some functionalities in Pyleoclim are supported by Pandas (and we will add more in the coming year). For now, Pandas represent the easiest way to get non-LiPD formatted data into Python for use with Pyleoclim. One of the main reasons we do not use Pandas is because most its advanced capabilities require a datetime format incompatible with paleoclimate data.

frontmatter.title: Module 5: Introduction to Matplotlib
frontmatter.description: This module will teach you how to use Matplotlib, a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations in Python. The module is structured around the visualization of two contemporaneous monthly timeseries: the NINO3 SST dataset and All India Rainfall, to explore potential connections.

frontmatter.title: Module 6: Introduction to Cartopy
frontmatter.description: This module will teach you about Cartopy, a mapping package used widely in the geosciences, including Pyleoclim.

frontmatter.title: Module 7: Introduction to GitHub
frontmatter.description: This module will teach you about Version Control and how to use Git and Github.

frontmatter.title: Module 8: Development best-practices including FAIR data principles
frontmatter.description: This module will teach you different aspects in regards to Data Workflows, handling filenames and best practices such as testing, continuous integration and licensing.

frontmatter.title: References and Resources
frontmatter.description: Here are scripts to re-use and links to additional references and topics to learn.
